snippet: Mrs. Clinton hopes to extend her edge over Donald J. Trump and help other Democrats in what party leaders think could become an election that swamps Republicans at every level....
abstract: Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign plans to mount new offensive in typically right-leaning states like Arizona, move meant to take advantage of growing lead over her opponent Donald Trump and to boost prospects for down-ballot candidates; some Democrats believe election could sweep party to victory in competitive House and Senate races.

byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and JONATHAN MARTIN

lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton hopes to extend her edge over Donald J. Trump and help other Democrats in what party leaders think could become an election that swamps Republicans at every level.

headline.main: Showing Confidence, Hillary Clinton Pushes Into Republican Strongholds
headline.print_headline: Clinton Pushes Into Bastions of the G.O.P.
